title: Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: mark-twain
summary: Huck Finn escapes his abusive father and travels down the Mississippi River with Jim, an escaped slave. Called 'the Great American Novel' by Ernest Hemingway, it remains controversial for its language and themes.

attribution.note: Book data from Open Library (openlibrary.org), part of Internet Archive.

description:
Adventures of Huckleberry Finn or as it is known in more recent editions, The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn, is a novel by American author Mark Twain, which was first published in the United Kingdom in December 1884 and in the United States in February 1885.
